intro: Strasburgeria calliantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a member of the Proteaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small, evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. Strasburgeria calliantha is well adapted to the dry, coastal environments of Hawaii, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
